storyInfo: At the Tri-Clan Council, all three clans have knives to each others' throats. With the deadlock unabating, Enciodes proposes the three clans transfer power to the Saintess, igniting a fierce dispute. In the end, the Saintess Enya chooses to accept the transfer.

attributes.content: Tch. It's taking too long.
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Keep it down, Sciurus. You're interrupting my train of thought.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: What's to think about? Enciodes has to hand his land over this time.
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Yucatan, your opinion?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: ...I agree with Rus, but Sir Enciodes won't just lie down and take it.
attributes.name: Yucatan

attributes.content: At least you think before you talk. Unlike your wife here.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Oh, who exactly is this about?!
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: You, of course, my beautiful little sister.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: If only it wasn't for Arctosz and his idiot face firing off at anything to do with Karlan. I didn't want to fall out with Enciodes this soon, that's for sure.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: People like Enciodes are a handful. Even if he croaks, he'll be sure to put us on the brink too at least. Not to mention...
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Something tells me he won't accept his sorry lot, and it's telling me loud.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Hmph. In my view...
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: I said keep it down, Sciurus. If you really have something to say, you can go outside, and then tell the mountains about it.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Of course, I won't let you back indoors.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Tch. Fine, I'll just shut up then.
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: (Murmured) So happy to talk to yourself.
attributes.name: Sciurus

attributes.content: Sir Arctosz arrives.
attributes.name: Devotee

attributes.content: At the summit of Karlan in winter, the frigid winds never rest, but the look in Arctosz's eyes, and the sound of his great axe as it drags along the ground in bursts, come to fool people—it's as if the winds are his to bring.
Look who's here, Arctosz, my fine friend.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Enciodes?
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Who am I to answer that?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I thought you would've bumped into each other outside and settled everything there, and that way I wouldn't need to be tormented in here, and I could go home happy.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: How surprising that something can even torment you, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Of course. I've got torment to the nines.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Such as, more and more people in my territory wanting to work for a living at Enciodes's instead.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Or, Gulo, the most able officer you have, not showing up today. Why?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: He caught a cold.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Kjerag's sturdiest soldier catching a cold. That's no good omen.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Looks like we'll need that man under Enciodes to give him some treatment. Gnosis, that one.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: He'll get better on his own.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Fine, fine. No good deed of mine goes unpunished.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Seeing as you're here, it looks like we're just missing Enciodes now.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: The three o'clock chime has not yet sounded.
I see I've kept the two of you waiting.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: S-Sir Enciodes and the Great Elder arrive!
attributes.name: Devotee

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Tch, there's a mystery. Why are the two of them together...?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Enciodes, don't tell me you went praying to the Saintess before coming to this meeting?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Far from it. I met the Great Elder along the way, and had a few words with him.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Great Elder, you first.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: A fine courtesy.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: The entrance to the hall slowly shuts, the air inside settling down in an instant after.
The Great Elder sits straight in the middle, Arctosz and Ratatos stand to one side, and Enciodes to the other.
The gulf of difference is stark.
Former Tri-Clan Councils always had us sit together, talking of the year's crop of affairs, of whose house had done more, and of whose required assistance after blights of snow.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: I had not foreseen such a topic at today's council... *sigh*.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: You'll want to really grill Enciodes about that.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: No need for such aggression, Arctosz.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: As the Great Elder said, the Tri-Clan Council should be no place for us to blame and reproach each other.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I wonder if you've heard one about the pot and the kettle, Enciodes.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Enough, enough. Given we are all here, we shall commence this meeting of the Tri-Clan Council.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: By Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: By Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Everyone

attributes.content: I presume all three are aware of the purpose of this Council.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: On Mr. Arctosz and Ms. Ratatos's proposal, last meeting, that the Silverashes would cede governing authority over the valleys and mining regions, for the Paleroches and Browntails to then administrate.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: In addition, the Silverashes' withdrawal from the parliament of the Tri-Clan Council.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: Gnosis Edelweiss has been expelled from his post by myself. I believe both of you know this already.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: What good does knowing that do? Gnosis is your aide. How could his actions not have been according to your instruction?
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: If you think pinning the blame on him will let you escape punishment, then think again!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Arctosz, why come to such an arbitrary conclusion?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Enciodes, there's much I can tolerate from you. You can open your factories in your territory, do your business, recruit your foreigners.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: That is your territory. Whatever ghoulish form you twist it into, it's not my concern.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: But never should you have led your railroad to Karlan, bringing the copper stench onto holy earth. And your mining up to Karlan's foot, extracting resources in secret, is beyond the pale.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: What do you take the ground of Karlan for—what do you take the land of Kjeragandr for?
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: You even plotted against any inspection teams so that they wouldn't investigate your factories. My subordinates are still bedbound for it.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Is that what you want to say? That these are all the doing of that accursed Edelweiss, and nothing to do with you?!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Gnosis was once my most trusted partner, and I mistakenly gave him too much power.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: For that, I am deeply regretful.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: What of you, Ratatos? Is there really no leeway to reverse course between us?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: *sigh* I really would love to help you, Enciodes.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: After all, six whole years ago, it was me who paved your way back into this hall. Of course it hurts, pushing you out again by my own hands.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: But in the end, when it's about all of Kjerag, I just can't defend you.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Though I believe the Browntails have benefited, greatly, from business in Turicum.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Am I denying that? It's not just money in our pockets, we can reap the rewards with our subjects too. Who wouldn't be a fan? Only sticks-in-the-mud like Arctosz.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: But even though people talk behind my back thanks to it, crying witch about me, I still have a bottom line, Enciodes.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I don't know what you read or learned in those four years you studied outside, that drives you to abuse our trust to this point.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I was wrong about you six years ago, Enciodes. I'll pay for that in time—but you're going to pay first.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Ceding the valleys and mines under our jurisdiction, as well as the Silverashes' seat at the Tri-Clan Council. These are your demands. Is it not an excessively high price?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Karlan Trade has already stricken its then-director in these affairs, Gnosis, off its register. The company's growth policy has recently mildened too, that much is plain to see.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Too late, Enciodes.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: If this price wasn't high, how would you ever remember it?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: If you wanted to seek forgiveness, you never would've done any of this in the first place.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: But since you have done it already, then today, here and now, you must pay something for it.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Are you handing over governance of the valleys and mines, or are you not? Are you seceding from the Tri-Clan Council, or are you not?
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: All I have done up to now was for the development of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: That it would worsen our relations with the Paleroches and Browntails to this present extent, was never my wish.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: And from the exchanges I've just had with the two of you, I see this worsening is already unavertable, and unredeemable.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I somewhat foresaw it, but to arrive at this moment in reality, at this time of grievance and ultimatum in this hall, still fills me with sorrow.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: But I truly cannot bear to see a fissure arise in the three clans that govern Kjerag together.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Dissent in the three clans signifies dissent in Kjerag. It signifies, that Kjeragandr's people, are soon to lose their collective homeland.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Enciodes, if you truly thought so, if you truly ever thought so for even one moment...
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: You would have sent yourself packing from Kjerag, back to your Victoria, and been a worry less on Kjerag herself!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Arctosz. I, Enciodes Silverash, am the head of the Silverashes.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: This means I must bear my responsibility for the future of Kjerag, and fulfil what is obliged of me.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I don't know what makes you feel I should have stayed in Victoria. Is it because those days of only two clans in parliament made you feel so much more powerful?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Not to mention, my reforms in the years I've led the Silverashes are a done reality...
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: The people of my territory haven't just gained from the way of life I've brought, they've continued to advance such lives by their own accord.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Even if I leave, the machines will still work, and the trains on the tracks will still set into motion.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Or do you truly believe that if I hand off the valleys and mines today, and cease operation of those factories and railroads...
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: That the people working there, the people benefiting from what it produces, will accede?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: That's your problem to solve, Enciodes.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: No, Ratatos. Maybe you have incredible trust in my problem-solving ability, but at base, this is not a problem I alone must face.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You wouldn't suggest that the Browntails' subjects have never profited any from these years Karlan Trade has done business?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: How many people have the Originium stoves kept going through the coldest winters, procured from Columbia by Karlan Trade? There are no Catastrophes in our mountains, but the ice and snow still claim lives.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: What is so disgraceful about the herders' prods, or the fertilizer that comes from Victoria?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You brought about this situation today—including your constant embellishment of yourself—and now you're using that same situation to menace us, shamelessly.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Get it out. Say this is all your accomplishment. Say you're powerless to give those of Kjerag self-sufficiency, and that you're not afraid to have them mocking you. You, head of the Silverashes.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Wrong, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: To menace is the bluff of one who lacks confidence, while I—am only recounting the truth.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You deem Karlan Trade as a menace to Kjerag. That, in itself, is a mockery beyond the heavens.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Keh...
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: You've got some gall by the sound of it, Enciodes. I remember. You've been good at talking this sort of talk ever since you were young.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Don't waste your breath, Enciodes.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Today, you will...
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Would I not hand it over today, General Gulo would have directly 'assumed' control of the valleys, having been stationed close by long ago.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Don't be so quick to resort to force, Arctosz.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I can make commitments and decisions, accordingly, to your proposals.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Conflict has been far from my intent up to now. As the head, I will not put up with any losses either.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: But if it's for putting this grievous state of affairs in check, for the alliance of the three clans of the snow mountains, then in the capacity of Kjeragandr's people, the Silverashes can make concessions.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: —I am fully able to offer the valleys and mines, with both hands.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You're serious?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: You can say a fine line! Enciodes, there's no one here who'll be taken in by your drivel!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Hence why I say, Arctosz, don't rush.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Impetuousness will be your weakness, guardian axe of Kjeragandr, most pious soldier of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I can accept these conditions you two have devised. But it will not be handed to the Paleroches, nor the Browntails.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Then to whom do you give it? What, Kjeragandr?!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Completely correct, Arctosz, most faithful of the people of Kjeragandr.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Every inch of territory of the Silverashes, and of you all too, is fundamentally accorded to us by Kjeragandr's trust. We merely supervise it in Kjeragandr's place.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: ...Hold on, you can't be...
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: It is as you imagine, Ratatos.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I've decided I will hear your demands, and give the Silverashes' valleys and mines in whole to the Vine-Bead Court, for the Saintess to handle its factories and pits.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: So as to avert conflict between the three clans, Kjerag ought to have a leader who can hold the faith of both the three clans, and the Snow Realm's citizens, at once.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Though we've managed, I believe that having the vicar of Kjeragandr take control of Kjerag once again, as in times past, is a fair and reasonable thing.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I imagine that peacefully settling this issue, peacefully partitioning the Silverashes' assets, and peacefully avoiding a direct clash of the three families, is what we hope for by all rights.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Ratatos, Arctosz—I can give up my valley and mines on this one condition. What do you think?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: A spell of silence. The attending nobles look amongst each other, trying to comprehend what purpose lies within the words.
The only sound, the scratching of the transcriber's pen, but that freezes too a few short seconds later, hung in the atmosphere.
The first to break the silence is a pencil as it carelessly clatters to the ground, alongside a stunned gasp from an unknown someone.
Immediately, consciously, low murmurs of discussion arise one after another, as if a pan of rösti in lowly heated oil.
Look! Is that the man from the Edelweisses...
attributes.name: Talkative Noblewoman

attributes.content: That Gnosis cur has the nerve to show his face here. I spit on him.
attributes.name: Scathing Nobleman

attributes.content: Good word, he's turned this way!
attributes.name: Talkative Noblewoman

attributes.content: Pah. See the look in his eyes. Heaven knows why Mr. Enciodes ever gave him such great responsibility, when his parents clearly plotted...
attributes.name: Scathing Nobleman

attributes.content: Tut-tut-tut, shush it, now! You'll anger Kjeragandr if you speak of these things atop Karlan!
attributes.name: Talkative Noblewoman

attributes.content: Though you have to admit, his happy days are at an end. Mr. Enciodes obviously couldn't tolerate his conduct one second longer.
attributes.name: Talkative Noblewoman

attributes.content: Really? Did Mr. Enciodes finally pull him from his post?
attributes.name: Scathing Nobleman

attributes.content: Yes! Didn't you know? At the Council last month, he removed him from his office on the spot...
attributes.name: Talkative Noblewoman

attributes.content: He's already out, then? That's wonderful! His number was long up!
attributes.name: Scathing Nobleman

attributes.content: Sir Gnosis.
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: I've warned that we should not converse on these occasions.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: Yes, my apologies.
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: Only... I received an urgent message. The train carrying Rhodes Island's delegation is almost at Karlan's foot already.
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: You had some interest in this company. Do you want to go and meet them?
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: The Snow Realm has reached a major juncture. If they're external forces that have been drawn in, then I'll naturally meet them when the time comes. No need to go out of my way.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: Besides... I'm merely an employee on probation now. What position do I have as pretext to meet them?
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: It really was disappointing to see how Enciodes acted, ejecting you as a figurehead just to appease the other two clans.
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: Appease? Enciodes's thoughts are by no means as simple as that.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: I've heard Rhodes Island really did succeed in slowing the exacerbation of Ensia's Oripathy?
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: Hm. Then they do, in fact, have the resources to win the Silverashes' favor.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: But the attention of Enciodes is both a blessing and curse. No easy judgments yet.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: There is no extraneous meaning to what I said.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: Anyhow, presumably those in the company must have applauded and cheered, the same way those two dilettantes did just now, hearing I was gone.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: None of them understand your worth, Sir Gnosis.
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: Using the word 'worth' to describe a person implies that person can be weighed.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: Sir...
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: By now, Enciodes should have proposed his idea for the Saintess to lead the Tri-Clan Council.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: The meeting hall, at this moment, should be utter chaos.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: Enciodes, in the end, this is the step you took after all.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: You're the one who understands Enciodes the most. Only you can stand in the way of his ambitions.
attributes.name: Monch

attributes.content: The wind's picked up. It's going to snow.
attributes.name: Gnosis

attributes.content: A massive snowflake sticks against Gnosis's shoulder, only for the frigid wind to pitilessly, immediately blow it off.
Kjerag's snowstorms are far from rare. They only need the clouds to gather thick enough, waiting just for a turning point.
And once the equilibrium of the air that supported those clouds is smashed, and loses its bracing power—

attributes.text: Does Enciodes seriously mean for the Saintess to become Kjerag's queen?
Impossible! This is Enciodes we're talking about!
But he seemed serious about those ideas he spouted just now...
No matter how you put it, think how incredible it'd be if Kjerag could unite under the Saintess's leadership! Kjeragandr's land really should return to Kjeragandr!

attributes.content: The whispers amongst the bystanders come together, and momentarily, the roar of the wind outside the window is covered by the voices.
...Enciodes, do you have any idea what you're saying?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I'm clear as could be.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Let us lay everything out in the open.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I originally held that, so long as results were had and the Silverashes' sincerity was clear to you all, you would discard your prejudices, and hand in hand with me, lead Kjerag forward.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: If the three clans could act together, then regardless of any difference in earnings—
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: A country's stance upon foreign trade versus a company's stance upon foreign trade are completely divorced concepts, and the results obtained will be a world apart.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Maybe my pace was too fast, and led you to believe instead I was planning to submissively hand Kjerag to outsiders?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: As if you weren't? Enciodes, Karlan IS NOT your theater to act in! Kjeragandr will punish you for every lie you've spewed!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: In that case, that Karlan still permits me to stand here is my greatest proof.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Leave it at that. I know full well I can't change your thinking, but I don't plan to alter Karlan Trade policy because of your shortsightedness either.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Karlan Trade values Kjerag's mines and factories, but they aren't the totality of the company. Letting them bring the company into stasis is far less worth it to me.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: If we let an eye for an eye go any further, then in the long run, we'll have spent excessive energy on uniting our views, and it'll have given outside threats a chance to hijack.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Like you, this is in no way what I want.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Therefore—
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I ultimately resolve to hand over all executive power to the Saintess.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: It will be for the Saintess to determine. I can accept this arrangement, and I believe all present can too.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: A heap of nonsense!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Who would believe words like these from someone trampling on the faith of Kjeragandr?!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Trampling?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I know that's how you see it. Many harbor prejudice towards the change Karlan Trade has brought.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: But labor is the very foundation on which Kjerag was stood.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Forget not that should they still have work at noon, the Browntails' people pass on kneeling in prayer to Karlan.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: And if things are busy, they certainly do not take the monthly visit to Karlan to hear the teachings.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Ha. Enciodes, pulling some hamfisted strawman like this isn't one bit persuasive.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: What next? Are you going to say that everything you've done to Karlan is by Kjeragandr's counsel?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: 'Kjeragandr,' Page 1, Line 1.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: 'Her tears are the ice eternally unmelting, Her back the unbreaking mountain, Her breath the cold wind of winter, Her smile the warm light of spring.'
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: 'When She awakes, shall the mountains summon Her, and the sky cast down lustrous spectra.'
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: No one has ever said that the Holy Mount can truly stand for Her.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Mt. Karlan's uniqueness is owed to the Vine-Bead Court being situated on it.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: If you denounce me for harm of the Vine-Bead Court's interests, I will readily concede that. Besides, I have brought my full good faith.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: And in addition, 'those who toil will hold power, and those who idle will suffer.'
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I have never gone against Her teachings.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Utter, utter tripe!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: The Vine-Bead Court is Kjeragandr's representative upon this land, and the Saintess of the Vine-Bead Court Her Terran speaker! How do you think you can change this with a mere few utterances?!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Great Elder, will the Vine-Bead Court suffer these wild lies?!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Naturally, I have to protest what Mr. Enciodes says.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: However, day in and day out, the scholars wage countless disputes over interpretations of Her words. The Vine-Bead Court is not a place of outlawed dissent, by any means.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: Who is right, and who is wrong? Far be it from you or me to have the final say, Arctosz.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Page 3, Line 5.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: 'In the beginning, Kjerag had but one untamed settlement, so until She lifted Her head from amidst the mountains.'
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: This time, following Enciodes's start, some nobles present notably begin to recite alongside him.
'She became as human, and lived in survival with the untamed. Yet they feared Her might, and honored Her as Divine.'
'More came to gather at Her side, and so was Kjerag born, and She, its first ruler.'
'Under Her guidance, did Kjerag flourish and thrive in bountifulness.'
Arctosz, tell me. What does Page 321, Line 1 say?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: '...After She held the kingdom for three centuries, there came one sudden day when She passed the ruler's title to Her helper, and vanished amidst the blizzard.'
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: 'Henceforth, Kjerag was given unto the people's hands.'
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Everyone, we are all of Kjerag, and all Her people.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: It is exactly as I said before—
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: If there is someone able to determine how we should proceed, then it is not I, nor you, nor Ratatos.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: This someone must be Her speaker, the Saintess.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: That we do not trust each other won't matter.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: The Saintess will determine for us, and show us towards the future.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Or do you mean to admit, somehow, that you don't trust the Saintess to make the fairest ruling, that you don't trust Her speaker upon the land?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: In an instant, the attention of every noble there focuses onto Arctosz.
You...! Enciodes, how dare you!
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Enciodes, if you're hoping this level of provocation will rouse any reaction in us, then that's far too disappointing of you.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: The Saintess was born a Silverash, that we all know.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: But her character is equivalently common knowledge.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: She is still Kjerag's Saintess. From the moment she received the glory and duty of Kjeragandr, the people of Kjerag have been witness to her every word and action.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: Her conduct has been impartial, ever since she took up the title. As things stand, how can we be skeptical of her simply for her common birth?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: It's like you just said. Kjeragandr was broad of heart, and resolved to give Kjerag's future to Her people.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: But you. You, Enciodes, choosing only now after all this time to bring up Kjeragandr, expounding on Her virtue and benevolence. Is that not out of some ulterior motive, really?
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: You are the one disrespecting the Saintess, Enciodes, coming in with sophistry to coerce and take advantage of her people!
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: That's a grave accusation, Ratatos, far graver than your criticisms of Karlan Trade.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: It seems our continuing this discussion further will only add to the maelstrom of conjecture. Given so, we may as well ask the Saintess to come here, and we'll set things straight in front of her.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Hmph, no objections. With all three clans gathered here, I expect there won't be any room for your tricks.
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Well, then. In the interest of fairness, may we trouble the Great Elder in our humble request of the Saintess?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: So be it. I'll go and ask her. Exercise patience, please.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: I think it might be snowing outside.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: What's so strange about that? The snow never stops falling on this mountain.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Something's different.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: ...So, Enciodes proposes the three families hand their power to me, for me to decide Kjerag's future?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: What do you think of it, Enya?
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Well met, Great Elder.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Enya. Here you are.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: I imagine you've probably heard about the assembly's affairs.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: If you mean the transferral of power, yes, I already know.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: There's been progress, then, if you've come for me now?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Keen ever since you were little, young one.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: It's reached the point where the clans' views clash like fire and water.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: Before this Council convened, Silverash gave me a hint or two... that under the current situation, the plan he'd suggest may well deescalate.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: It seems you don't approve of my actions last Council after all, Great Elder.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Enya, oh, Enya.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: Come... child, look outside. Could you know the years it took, for the frost and snow to finally cover these mountains?
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: And could you know, how many years had to pass, for us to have this pure and holy summit where we stand?
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: ...I understand.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: But—'Her tears are the ice eternally unmelting, Her back the unbreaking mountain, Her breath the cold wind of winter, Her smile the warm light of spring.'
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: If everything was Kjeragandr's gift, then why must Kjeragandr's people still fear the blizzard?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: ...In that respect, you and him do seem alike... yet different, too...
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: Um, pardon me...?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Nothing, just an old man thinking aloud.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: What you say is correct, Saintess.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: You've spent all your time atop this summit, and the mountains have bowed to Kjeragandr's speaker in turn. To think so is quite right.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: However, in snow this great, built up over so many years, how many of Kjeragandr's people would be buried, should it ever collapse?
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: To me, Kjerag's peace of mind has always come first and foremost.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: I trust, Saintess, that you are the same.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: Hum... it's about time.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: The three are still in the hall awaiting you. You cannot appear too soon, but I wouldn't advise you be too late either. Now is the perfect time.
attributes.name: Great Elder

attributes.content: May you both come this way, please.
attributes.name: Kjarr

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Kjerag's peace of mind...
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Letting this snow carry on building underfoot, without a place for us to clear a way... will that be peace for Kjerag?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Kjeragandr, I pray, watch over your people...
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: In the wake of the blizzard sweeping the mountain, the clear, sharp bell strokes come as if from the heavens to the ears of Kjeragandr's people.
Where she passes, no noble fails to stand, offering the most formal etiquette, chanting the most devout prayer.
'Frost and snow have fallen by your will, to bring to Kjerag blessings.'
Saintess, it's been long.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: With your litany of occupations, you've neglected worship, Sir Enciodes. It truly has been long.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: You requested an investigation of the valleys and mines prior, Saintess. I could not, of course, neglect that.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Once all this is settled and done with, I will personally lead a procession in worship to Karlan.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Your faith in Kjeragandr is apparent throughout. Why be so elaborate in proving it?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: That's a fine jest, Great Saintess.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I hear a sister of yours has come back to Kjerag.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: You're well-informed, Saintess. She should be on the path to Karlan with an honored guest at this very moment.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: A guest?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Indeed. Up till now, my sister has been receiving treatment at a medical firm called Rhodes Island, for her Oripathy.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: For the coming Grand Ceremony, I've invited one of said firm's leaders to visit Kjerag, as a gesture of thanks.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You care much for your sister, Sir Enciodes. Truly, it is admirable.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: ...You flatter me, Saintess.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: I presume you already know of my proposal. What do you think of it?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: What are Sir Arctosz and Lady Ratatos's considerations?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: I, Arctosz, with my faith in Kjeragandr visible to all, say that let alone merely having the Saintess be the mediator of the three clans—
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: Hold it, Arctosz!
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: —I could hand my position as head to her, and what shame would it be?
attributes.name: Arctosz

attributes.content: And you, Lady Ratatos?
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Who could possibly say no in this moment?
Who would dare say no in this moment?
For the Great Saintess to be the arbitrator of the three clans, in this present situation, is indeed the best option.
attributes.name: Ratatos

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: As the three clans' heads all submit to this, and are willing to entrust themselves to me...
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: I shall—
attributes.name: Enya

attributes.content: Respond in kind to all, and assume the duty of guiding Kjerag.
attributes.name: Enya
